attributes.action: Increase the pensioners income limit to £42k
attributes.background: workers pay 20% tax up to £42k pensioners pay 30% over £27k.

attributes.action: Make people who claim Job Seekers Allowance do volunteering work
attributes.background: Please don't view this as an out of touch 50 year old something living in Kent ranting and fuming about how people these days don't do anything. I am sure that people claiming the allowance are literally just trying to find a job, and getting by on what they can, however it's a matter of principle.
attributes.additional_details: At time of writing (26/01/2016) there are 760,000 people claiming JSA, that is essentially three quarters of a million people ready to work on state projects, man food banks, and help towards the state. Obviously how this would be implemented would be up to the government, but just me thinking out loud.

attributes.action: Request our allies USA and Spain to recognise British Overseas Territories.
attributes.background: All 14 Overseas territories have the right to self determination. Spain demands Gibraltar and adds to tension between the UK and Argentina. When Argentina (who gets UK foreign aid) acknowledge this sovereignty our military can be withdrawn thus saving millions in tax payers money that the NHS need.
attributes.additional_details:
Facts
1)The USA does not recognise the Falkland Islands but recognises sunny Diego Garcia.  
2)Falkland Islanders held a referendum in March 2013 and 99% wanted to remain a British Overseas territory.
3)Argentina state that because the Falkland Islands are close to them it should be theirs. Please look at this map and see that by that logic Chile should have a bigger claim.  https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tierra_del_Fuego
4)Argentina is in the G20.
5) Why is the UK made to look like bad guys?

attributes.action: Brexit should NOT include free movement of people or contributions to EU funds.
attributes.background: We have voted to leave the EU and should not pay into it. They need to trade with us more than we need them.

attributes.action: Compulsory teaching of Economics at GCSE level.
attributes.background: Teaching Politics does not help voters make an informed decision on matters such as the EU Referendum, as it is largely an economical matter. It gives us little insight to the implications of our decisions. Economics gives children factual knowledge to allow them to form decisions on such matters.
attributes.additional_details:
The effect a decision will have on the economy is central to any debate or issue. To make an informed decision, people require knowledge (e.g how free markets work) and the effect their vote will have on the economy. Knowledge of Economics allows students to make educated and substantial choices.

By teaching Economics, this is providing students skills for adult life, a major issue with schools as they fail to teach students skills useful in adult life such as budgeting, taxes and employment.

attributes.action: Regulate car insurance companies over cost of car insurance
attributes.background: We the everyday motorists pay excessive amounts for car insurance, thre needs to be a look into their practice's and costing and needs to be capped or regulated
attributes.additional_details:
Car insurance for a 33yr old driver with no points , no accidents and 0 no claims on a 1.4 - £700 

Car insurance for same driver with 2 non fault accidents, 9 points for speeding when no accident involved and 1 years no claims on a 1.2 - £3500 

How can a insurance company expect to charge 5x for a smaller car when there has never been a cost to them .

attributes.action: Rights to vote for all migrants who have resided in the UK for the past 5 years.
attributes.background: We the undersigned call upon HM Government to extend the right to vote for the EU referendum to the migrants that have lived and worked in the UK for the past 5 years. We call a second referendum open to this minority that has not been included in the vote but that will be directly affected by it.

attributes.action: Review Visa requirements of the families of serving Commonwealth Soldiers
attributes.background: I highlight the case of a Fijian Soldier who is serving in the British Army who has been separated from his family due to current UK Visa laws. As this soldier does not earn the £27,000 required, his family are forced to remain in Fiji. He is also required to find £6000 just for a Visa application.
attributes.additional_details: The soldier in question served in Afghanistan then discharged from the Army. He subsequently rejoined into the MPGS. His family moved back to Fiji and are now unable to join him. He has seen his family once for 2 weeks in three years. It is unfair to have free movement within Europe yet serving Soldiers are unable to be accompanied due to archaic Visa regulations

attributes.action: Elmbridge Borough to become 33rd London borough following EU referendum
attributes.background: As London voted to remain in the EU, it is more evident than ever the similarities that the Borough of Elmbridge in North Surrey shares with neighbouring Greater London. As talks of further devolution of London develop, Elmbridge citizens must be protected.
attributes.additional_details:
In the EU referendum, 60% voted to remain with a turnout of 78%, similar to that of London.
Elmbridge has a vibrant economy with over 5000 firms situated in the borough.
Over 45% of Elmbridge's population are educated to degree level.
Unemployment peaked at 7% in 1993 but since then has been on the decline and reached a low of 0.9% in 2000.

attributes.action: Divert the £4,000,000 spent on Homeopathy to a Mental Health Awareness Campaign.
attributes.background: Every year, the NHS spends around £4 to £5 million on Homeopathy, a remedial pratice which has been repeatedly examined and found to have no long term health benefit other than placebo. This money could find better use as a national mental health awareness campaign to help curtail MH stigmatisation.
attributes.additional_details:
A 2010 review into homeopathy found that it was a 'placebo treatment'.
http://www.parliament.uk/business/committees/committees-archive/science-technology/s-t-homeopathy-inquiry/

This is an example of a mental health campaign which could be better funded with the extra money available from ceasing to fund homeopathy.
http://www.time-to-change.org.uk/

attributes.action: No general election until after Brexit
attributes.background: We call on the next Tory leader not to call a general election and concentrate on brexit and make the divorce from the EU smooth as possible

attributes.action: Hold independence referendums for London, Scotland, and Northern Ireland
attributes.background: The people of London, Scotland, and Northern Ireland are at risk of being taken out of the EU, despite voting heavily to remain. If Scotland is granted a 2nd independence referendum as a result of this, then the same choice should be granted to both London and Northern Ireland.
attributes.additional_details:
EU referendum results as reported by the BBC:

London: "Across all 33 boroughs in the capital, 59.9% (2.26 million) voted in favour of remaining in the EU. In some areas, the remain vote was more than 70%."

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-eu-referendum-36612916

Scotland: "Scotland has voted in favour of the UK staying in the EU by 62% to 38% - with all 32 council areas backing Remain."

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-scotland-scotland-politics-36599102

Northern Ireland: "Northern Ireland has voted to remain in the EU Referendum by a majority of 56% to 44%."

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-northern-ireland-36614443

attributes.action: Debate within 100 days the Government's costed plan for the UK to leave the EU
attributes.background: Good governance requires such a momentous change of national direction to be underpinned by a properly formulated plan with specific objectives, milestones for the change process and timescales for final delivery, detailed costings and an associated risk management plan.
attributes.additional_details: The people of the United Kingdom must be informed of the plan and its detail debated in Parliament within 100 days.

attributes.action: Citizens must pass GCSE level maths and English to vote
attributes.background: Citizens under the age of 18 are unable to vote due to not being mature enough to understand implications of elections and referendums. However, maturity should not be determined by age.
attributes.additional_details:
Passing basic mathematical and English competency tests will ensure voters are able to better make informed choices, and understand the implications and consequences of their voting choice. 

Very often voters are misinformed, and unable to distinguish fact from fiction due to their lack of education. It should therefore go without saying that not being able to understand basic maths and English should also correlate with poor understanding of elections and referendums.

attributes.action: Hold an EU referendum where it is illegal  to knowingly misrepresent the facts
attributes.background: Many people voted in The EU referendum based on statements which campaign Leaders have admitted were mistakes.  We believe there would have been a different outcome if it was illegal to make false representations to the public and call on the outcome to be set aside and a new referendum to be held

attributes.action: England (w/o London) and Wales become independent and get only them out of EU
attributes.background: In the wake of the Brexit referendum results there are different calls for the breakup of UK. An alternative solution to satisfy the voters, keep UK whole and partially within EU would be to devolve England (w/o London) and Wales and let them leave EU (like Crown dependencies currently are).

attributes.action: Stop government invoking Article 50 until there is a deal in UK's interests.
attributes.background: Most MPs, who are well aware of their constituents interests, support remaining in the EU.  They are the appropriate people to judge if deal is in the U.K.'s interests.  MPs should have the power to to ensure their constituents interests are safeguarded before there is an exit from the EU.

attributes.action: Give EU nationals living in the UK for 4 years or more automatic citizenship now
attributes.background:
We are asking parliament give citizenship to EU migrants living in the UK for more than 4 years to:

- prevent the loss of skilled workers
- honour year long contributions into the system 
- give re-assurance to over 3m EU migrants 
- make sure in future all views are represented and respected
attributes.additional_details:
This petition is not meant to be exclusive. Non-EU migrants have a clear set of defined rules however hence our friends are covered already and know where the road gores - WE DO NOT and need answers now from a country that has left us hanging. We represent almost 5% of the UK pubic - yet have no voice. 
4 years are based on the decisions made in the re-negotiations between the UK and the EU commission in Feb 2016. This petition follows the same rational (4 years entitle to benefits for example)

attributes.action: Introduce a direct democracy which gives power back to citizens
attributes.background: Direct democracy allows any citizen to challenge any law approved by the parliament or, at any time, propose a modification of the federal Constitution. Switzerlands direct democracy holds referendums to decide on new and current legislation. Its time to bring democracy back to the UK.

attributes.action: Allow 17 year olds to vote in future referendums and general elections.
attributes.background: Young people in college are not allowed to vote (if they're under 18) which is extremely unfair as it is our own future. It is ridiculous that those who are 65+ have such a say in our future. Ot is undemocratic that we have no say in our future, and it needs to stop. 17 year olds deserve the vote.

attributes.action: Hold a referendum on independence for London
attributes.background: Unlike the rest of the UK, London is predominantly Labour and the whole of London voted to remain in the EU. We are no longer philosophically in step with the rest of the UK. We suggest that London be afforded the opportunity to declare independence, or become part of Scotland, in a referendum.
attributes.additional_details:
London: housing crisis, Muslim Labour mayor, diverse and younger population, voted remain unanimously
Rest of UK: predominantly Conservative, voted for leaving the EU, affordable housing still exists

attributes.action: Mindfulness Meditation on the Curriculum
attributes.background: Add mindfulness meditation to the school curriculum to tackle the issues of stress, anxiety and poor concentration amongst young people.
attributes.additional_details: The Science Behind Mindfulness Meditation: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wP9731bDJlE

attributes.action: Ban letting agents from charging letting fees to renters.
attributes.background: Renters are hit with high costs every time they move. It is time to bring an end to expensive letting fees which are already banned in Scotland and which allow letting agents to unfairly 'double charge' both the landlord and the tenant.

attributes.action: Place more stringent requirements on school meals that are served at break.
attributes.background: Currently, at our school, the main meals are healthy, the menu varies and the quality of the produce is high, but as not all of the standards on health, quality and variety apply to break food, the same things are served every day. Fruit is there, but this is expensive and placed in a corner.
attributes.additional_details:
All school health standards should be applied to all meal servings, along with more defined legislation regarding variety and quality, especially for food served at mid-morning break. This will allow students to eat healthier options, eat a variety​ of food and know what they are consuming, no matter the time, is of high quality.

Food served at mid-morning break includes:
Pizza slices
Belgian Waffles - which are sprinkled in sugar
Donuts
Paninis
Bacon and cheese rolls - where there is 1cm of fat on each piece of bacon

attributes.action: Contribution to cost of teachers' holidays during Half-term and Summer holidays
attributes.background: Teachers work very hard for little pay. Often they cannot afford the holidays they deserve during their only allocated holiday time, as prices skyrocket during school holidays.
attributes.additional_details: As many people are aware prices to travel abroad or even to enjoy a holiday in the UK skyrocket outside of term time (during school holidays and half term). While parents have the option to take students out of school to avoid such price hikes teachers do not, as it is their duty to teach every single day. I believe teachers should receive a discount or monetary contribution towards holidays during half-term and Summer holidays.

attributes.action: Require ingredients to be listed on the packaging of all alcoholic drinks.
attributes.background: Soft drinks, rightly, have to list ingredients. We should also know what goes into the beer, wine and spirits that we consume.  Consumers will be able to make better decisions about what they drink if they know that preservatives,  flavourings or potential allergens are present.

attributes.action: Standardise Breastfeeding Advice & Support
attributes.background: Breastfeeding can be hard to establish without correct support or advice. Many mothers turn to formula and regret not being able to breastfeed. I found it incredibly confusing, being given conflicting advice from one midwife to the next, and found it daughting when I went home from hospital.
attributes.additional_details: You may have heard the saying: Breast is Best, but in the UK we have a considerably low number of breastfeeding mothers compared to other European countries. A lot of mothers turn to formula through lack of support or advice. So this petition is aimed at standardising the support and advice given. We need a better structure in place to help breastfeeding mothers to establish, maintain and continue breastfeeding for as long as they wish to nurse their baby/toddler.

attributes.action: Scrap the 15 year limit for voting rights of British citizens living abroad
attributes.background: British citizens who have lived abroad for 15 years are not allowed to vote at British elections. British citizens who live abroad in the EU will be the most effected by the results of the British referendum in June 2016. All of them must be allowed to participate in the referendum!!!
attributes.additional_details: British citizens who live abroad are also not allowed to vote in the country where they live because they do not have the citizenship in that country. They pay taxes and cannot vote in any country - this unfairness has to stop!!! The 15 year rule makes no sense in the modern world of telecommunication and with globally accessible media.

attributes.action: Make June 15th (signing of the Magna Carta) a bank holiday
attributes.background: Magna Carta is the foundation of our country. It is the beginning of our parliament, the oldest parliament in the world, and the origins of how we view society. So far the only memorial to it was made by the Americans who understand its importance and we should notice the Magna Carta's importance.
attributes.additional_details:
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Magna_Carta
Wiki page for the Magna Carta

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4qj2vpp9Wf4
UK parliament YouTube Page with a video on the document itself

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KhVnHQVbtB8
Daniel Hannan MEP's speech on the 800th anniversary of Magna Carta - speaking at Runnymede

attributes.action: Legislate for homeopathic medicines to be tested to provide proof of efficacy.
attributes.background: Under current legislation it is permissible for the manufacturers of homeopathic medicines to sell their products and have them prescribed on the NHS without any proof that they are an effective remedy for any ailment. This has the potential to defraud the purchaser.
attributes.additional_details: Government guidance on the registration of homeopathic medicines. https://www.gov.uk/guidance/register-a-homeopathic-medicine-or-remedy

attributes.action: Lower the voting age to 14
attributes.background: Lower the voting age to 14 so that this give a better chance for the young to have a go

attributes.action: MPs and council leaders should cease second occupations until they leave office.
attributes.background: To prevent conflict of interest in the political arena, any person representing the PEOPLE should cease any activities that produce a second income.
attributes.additional_details: When persons are employed by the public purse they should put 100% of their effort into their job. It is known that some tenders for works within the public sector have directly and indirectly benefited State employed individuals. This is morally wrong and adds to the current lack of trust the Public have in our Government and Councils.

attributes.action: Wood burning stoves should require a licence and regulated for nuisance.
attributes.background: Wood stoves create smoke and fumes that are unpleasant and dangerous to health. The government see these devices as cheap energy. Smoke and fumes produce particulates as harmful to health as diesels or secondary cigarette smoke. This fashion accessory is dangerous not romantic.
attributes.additional_details:
Building regulations are in force to ensure construction is safe, the clean air act is there to make the air we breath as safe as possible,  Environmental Health officers are there to prevent nuisance. 
Building control ignore there own rules and do not take notice of wind effect on the way smoke and fumes enter homes, Environmental Health are reluctant to make a nuisance case because the government policy is to support them, the clean air act is ignored. You cannot keep smoke and fumes out of your home and those with a duty of care ignore the risks. Even DEFRA do not know the full risks in there support of wood burning. Once installed of course anything is burnt. They need regulating and licencing.

attributes.action: Please include a 'Return to Sender Address' on your pro-EU Referendum leaflet.
attributes.background: Include a return to sender address
attributes.additional_details: 16 pages of unsolicited mail requires a return to sender address.

attributes.action: Allow news agencies unrestricted filming in the central lobby of Parliament
attributes.background:
Under present rules, only authorised photography is allowed. 

The UK is fortunate to have one of the world’s great public service broadcasters, not a state broadcaster. As such it is the role of government to allow public scrutiny of interactions and protests, even those critical of the state.
attributes.additional_details:
At lunchtime on 23rd March 2016, during Prime Ministers Questions, Black Rod, the official with responsibility for the parliamentary estates and security, ordered reporters not to take or tweet photos of a protest in the Central Lobby of the Palace of Westminster. 

The BBC’s Norman Smith, who has permission to broadcast from the central lobby, was ordered by the authorities to stop filming mid-broadcast.

http://tinyurl.com/BlackRodVideo

The democratic process must not be subject to censorship

attributes.action: Increase the number of physiotherapists in the NHS.
attributes.background:
Waiting times from a GP referral vary from 2 weeks to 3 months or more.
Prompter physiotherapy would:
1. Increase patient mobility, strength, coordination, confidence and well-being.
2. Prevent deterioration or accidents, thereby reducing treatment costs.
3. Reduce pressure on GPs and hospitals.

attributes.action: Save Violet Melchett Health Centre in Chelsea from Closure
attributes.background: Not only is it for family planning, the fantastic team also specialises in women's health and have helped me personally on numerous occasions with same day appointments, when I wasn't able to get an appointment with my GP. It would be a great loss to the Chelsea community if this centre closes.
attributes.additional_details:
https://community.avaaz.org/petitions/save-the-violet-melchett-health-centre-in-chelsea-1 

Chelsea may soon be losing its last remaining family planning clinic in plans being drawn up by the Royal Borough of Kensington and Chelsea (RBKC) and the NHS, residents and staff have reported. This is despite sexual health diagnoses running at a three year high.

If plans to relocate the Violet Melchett family planning clinic are executed, Chelsea will be left without a dedicated primary family planning clinic.

attributes.action:
Pay carers fair rate
Currently get £73.10wk for35 hrs of care
That's £2.08ph
attributes.background:
Adult carer's currently get £2.08 per hour for providing up to 35 hours of care a week,
The minimum wage is currently £6.70 for over 21.
Let's improve the quality of life for BOTH cared for and carer's PLEASE.
I hear if you are a member of house of Lords you get £350.00 a day for just turning up.
attributes.additional_details:
I am an Independent disabled man.
I was damaged by accidents during surgery.
I need a fair amount of care at times.

attributes.action: Bring Back national service in the UK with forced  conscription
attributes.background: men and women in the uk are fat and lazy and they need to get tough  so the army,royal navy,raf are the way to go.
attributes.additional_details: my late step granddad did national service it made him in to a better man he learnt life skills and went around the world and loved it.

attributes.action: Oppose plans  for responsibility all asylum claims being shifted to the EASO
attributes.background: The FT has brought to our attention plans to make the an EU agency (European Asylum Support Office) responsible for all asylum claims within the EU including the UK, this will mean the UK government will lose control over immigration policy for people arriving from OUTSIDE the EU.
attributes.additional_details:
The story was broken by the Financial times on the 7th March and was also featured on Yahoo news:

http://news.yahoo.com/brussels-propose-overhaul-eu-asylum-system-report-001724988.html

Whether you think we should take more or less non EU migrants surely the member states and not the EU should decide it's migration policy not the EU.

I think we should have assurances of the government position on this issue and whether the Prime Minister and leader of the opposition will oppose these changes.

attributes.action: Make it law that employees are given a day off in lieu for 29 February.
attributes.background: Regardless of what day of the week 29 February falls on, ultimately every 4 years employees are expected to work an extra day, without additional pay. Employers should give employees an extra day off work in lieu every 4 years.

attributes.action: Government to stop giving immigrants and refugees free ESOL and education.
attributes.background: Colleges and educational facilities to stop giving free education to refugees and immigrants funded by the government the educational funds should be given to uk citizens and non citizens should have to pay for their education. bursaries and grants and free courses only available to uk citizens
attributes.additional_details: The amount of money our government spends on education on immigrants and refugees is more then what is allocated to uk citizens. Refugees and immigrants if they can't speak English should pay fees for this education not taking tax payers money to fund this colleges and educational facilities are now over run with ESOL classes ran for free but this money should be allocated to help uk citizens only

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for anyone who harms a disabled child to go to jail
attributes.background: My son who has autism was assaulted by a member of staff at his care home, she was charged with child cruelty, but because she became pregnant she avoided jail. i think anyone who hurts a disabled child should be sent to jail. if you agree please sign

attributes.action: make it compulsory for all pet sitters to be licenced for all pet related work
attributes.background: Kennels, Pet stores and Home boarders are required to be licenced by the local council but pet sitters and dog walkers are able to trade without any training, experience or governing body allowing anybody to care for peoples pets. This is not only bad for animal welfare but also bad for the industry

attributes.action: Prevent Highways agency from removing centre white lines from UK roads
attributes.background: The Highways Agency argue that removing the centre white line creates driver uncertainty and a resultant reduction in speed which will reduce Road Traffic Collisions. There is a groundswell of opinion that a lot of drivers use the white line as a measure of safe road positioning.
attributes.additional_details:
Speaking to The Times, AA’s head of road policy, Paul Watters, said: ‘Without exaggeration it is true to say that a simple pot of paint can save lives.
‘In particular, highly visible markings at the edge and centre of the road that can be seen on a wet night are enormously cost-effective in saving lives.’

attributes.action: Re-open the Railway line from Butterley
attributes.background:
I would like the UK Government to consider reopening the former Midland Railway line that ran from Butterley to Derby which also linked up with the Ambergate to Pye Bridge railway line

I believe reopening the section of the line between Butterley and Pye Bridge has huge benefits.
attributes.additional_details:
I think the top authority for the county of Derbyshire, which is Derbyshire County Council should back this petition, because something needs to be done in order to reopen this railway line, and bring back trains to the area!

Trains are needed in this area, in order to reconnect this part of the county that hasn't had a train pass through it in over fifty years!

attributes.action: Make childcare funding available quickly and pay directly to childcare providers
attributes.background: The HMRC can take up to 12 weeks and often longer before they approve funding and pay out to the parents If the HMRC could change their regulations and give child minders guarantee than parents could go back to employment easier and childcare providers would be assured of payment for their services.
attributes.additional_details: As child minders we find ourselves often in the situation where parents build up a back log of fees outstanding because the HMRC haven't approved their funding or stopped it. What do you do in such a situation? We have built up relationships with the child and its parent(s) and its not in the best interest of the child to terminate it. We want the HMRC to speed up the process and pay the child care provider directly to give us security for the hard work we do.

attributes.action: Hold a referendum to move the Houses of Parliament out of London permanently.
attributes.background: The Houses of Parliament require refurbishment.  There appears to have been no REAL consideration of why it needs to remain in central London.  Cost savings and befits of decentralisation from London centric economy would all be achieved by moving it elsewhere in the UK

attributes.action: Make finding cures for our cancers the number one scientific priority.
attributes.background: In the UK, one out of every three people will develope cancer, that's a third of the goverment's voters! One in eight females will develope breast cancer- that's one in every fourth house! Both my wife and daughter have been diagnosed, so I'm motivated to get this goverment's priorities changed!
attributes.additional_details: We need to march in the streets banging big drums until things change! Humankind has an inherent selfish streak; we would rather entertain ourselves by spending billions of Euros, sending a spaceprobe to Mars in the hope of getting a clue, as to whether sola winds, could have been the cause of Mars losing its atmospere millions of years ago. Knowledge we can survive without. We don't need the serendipitous crumbs that may fall off the table of space exploration, but specifically targeted funds!

attributes.action: Make Car Insurance Company pay back 20% of Annual premium if no claims were made
attributes.background: Motorist in the UK pay an unjustified amount of annual premium on their car insurance. This however doesn't necessarily reduce with every year that passes by. The insane cost of car insurance ranges from £300-£3000/year in most cases. I believe careful drivers should be rewarded with a 20%cash back.
